member.summary: The Azure SQL Database Management API includes operations for managing the server-level Firewall Rules for Azure SQL Database Servers. member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Sql.Models.DatabaseEditions
member.summary: Defines the valid editions of Azure SQL Databases.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Sql.Models.DatabaseEditions.Web
member.summary: The Web Edition Database is best suited for small Web applications and workgroup or departmental applications. This edition supports a database with a maximum size of 1 or 5 GB of data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Sql.Models.DatabaseEditions.Business
member.summary: The Business Edition Database is best suited for independent software vendors (ISVs), line-of-business (LOB) applications, and enterprise applications. This edition supports a database of up to 150 GB of data, in 10GB increments up to 50GB, and then 50 GB increments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Sql.Models.DatabaseEditions.Standard
member.summary: The Standard Edition Database is best suited for a group of users makingfewer than 1000 transactions per minute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Sql.Models.DatabaseEditions.Premium
member.summary: The Premium Edition Database is for situations requiring a high number of transactionsper second (>100). Supports more users than Basic and Standard.

member.summary: The Azure SQL Database Management API includes operations for managing the server-level Firewall Rules for Azure SQL Database Servers.
